easy.notes: Easy groups are straightforward and based on familiar, concrete ideas. Sunny Things group things seen in the sky; Modes of Travel groups common ways to get around; Animal Sounds lists common animal vocalizations; Common Shapes covers basic geometric shapes.

medium.notes: Medium groups introduce mild wordplay and two-step ideas. Prefix group centers on the shared start 'play'. Double-Use Words rely on common single words that also serve another common meaning. Colorful Objects blend color with common nouns. Tools are everyday objects; ensure each item clearly fits only its intended group.

hard.notes: Hard groups require slightly abstract connections. Hidden Relationships uses time-related items that link to measurement or record-keeping. Opposites with a Twist presents true opposites but with a simple added clue to avoid obvious duplicates. Parts of a Whole contains components that fit together. Sequences in Nature shows a natural growth progression. Near-miss temptation: items like 'clock' might seem related to time, but 'clock' would not fit cleanly with the calendar/time progression as a group; ensure each item strictly belongs to its designated group.
